newsitem.title: USA: Gates fortune tops $20 billion as Microsoft rises.
newsitem.headline: Gates fortune tops $20 billion as Microsoft rises.

text.p: Say hello to the $20 billion man.
When Microsoft Corp. stock rose Wednesday, Chairman Bill Gates' stake in the giant software company grew in value to more than $20 billion, according to recent disclosure statements.
Gates, America's wealthiest individual, owned slightly more than 141 million shares, or about 24 percent of the Redmond, Wash.-based company, as of Sept. 9, according to a proxy statement.
Microsoft rose $3 to $144.50, giving Gates a stake valued at about $20.37 billion.
That's up from about $13.13 billion a year ago, reflecting a 55 percent increase in Microsoft stock price -- and Gates' sale of nearly 52,000 shares for living expenses.
Gates earned only $563,000 in salary and bonus in the latest fiscal year and is the only one of Microsoft's 20,000 employees not eligible for stock options.
Gates, 41, was ranked the richest man in America by Forbes magazine last month, when his fortune was valued at a mere $18.5 billion.
Nebraska investor Warren Buffett was second with a stock-based fortune of $15 billion.

Third on the list was Microsoft co-founder Paul Allen, whose Microsoft stake was worth $7.7 billion at Wednesday's prices. Allen, who sits on Microsoft's board but no longer manages the company, also owns sports, entertainment and technology properties including Ticketmaster.
